> You should be sure to specify the technical side of things though, 
however
> I'm not sure if they fall under the official rules...
> This includes things like in what format to send your saved games, 
how to
> label them, etc.
> 
> - Deathifier
> *Runs for cover in case of violation of voting conditions*

Hehe.  Oops, the tournament group wasn't specific enough.  We'll bring 
that point up in a discussion.  No violation recorded.  BTW, if the 
only thing I would do if someone violated conditions is just 
adjust an individual member's profile to require his/her posts to get 
moderator approval.  I'm counting on not having to do that.

Just to clarify things:

Something that would be a violation is: "I would need more time to 
complete tournament scenarios so I am voting against that rule."

Mentioning (not discussing) things that were overlooked in the rules 
is OK.  I just don't want to see a debate about the merits of each 
individual rule.  If anyone needs a rule clarified before voting, feel 
free to ask for clarifications.

BTW, I am also going to be recording email addresses who voted on the 
proposed rules.  This way I can start putting together a list of 
potential tournament players.
